Includes material reprinted from: Amazing Spider-Man #513-514 and Amazing Spider-Man #361-362.

Can Spider-Man survive Mister Negative's poison gas attack, and if so can he stop him from slaying the Maggia crime families?

By Dan Slott and Steve McNiven.

Plus: Who is Jackpot? New York's latest crime fighter?

By Mark Guggenheim and Salvador Larroca.

Classic action guest starring Wolverine! Peter Parker decides to give up being Spider-Man and heads to Germany!

BY James C. Owsley and Mark Bright.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #546
  • Amazing Spider-Man #548-549
  • Spider-Man vs. Wolverine #1

A deadly new foe bursts onto the scene too threaten Spider-Man! Prepare for the Début of Menace!

By Marc Guggenheim and Salvador Larroca.

Plus: Spider-Man and Wolverine find themselves stuck in a Cold War!

By James Owsley and Mark Bright.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #550-551
  • Spider-Man vs.Wolverine #1

A deadly new foe emerges to threaten everyone! But who - or what - is Freak?

By Bob Gale and Phil Jimenez.

Plus: Classic action. Spider-Man Versus Wolverine!!

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #552-553
  • Spider-Man vs. Wolverine: #1

Spidey and Wolverine fight side-by-side against mysterious, masked warriors!

By Zeb Wells and Chris Bachalo.

Also: The final showdown between Freak and Spider-Man!

By Bob Gale and Phil Jimenez.

Plus: The secrets of the Hobgoblin finally revealed!

By Peter David, Alan Kupperburg and Tom Morgan.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #554-555
  • Spider-Man vs. Wolverine

An ancient Death God appears in New York intent on destroying all before it!

By Zeb Wells and Chris Bachalo.

Also: Spider-Man versus Hobgoblin!

By Peter David and Alan Kupperburg.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #556-557
  • Amazing Spider-Man #289

Spider-Man is in trouble as the Freak and Menace returns looking for revenge!

By Bob Gale and Barry Kitson

Plus: The début of two new foes Screwball and the mysterious PaperDoll.

By Dan Slott and Marcos Martin.

Classic action: In the aftermath of Spider-Man versus Wolverine. The Web-slinger and Wolverine are side-by-side again.

By James C. Owsley and Steve Geiger.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #558-559
  • Web of Spider-Man #29

Peter Parker finds his new job as a paparazzo comes at a high price, and the psychotic PaperDoll attacks, and the return of Mary Jane!

By Dan Slott and Marcos Martin.

Classic action: A defining moment in Peter Parker's life as he asks a BIG question!

By David Micheline and John Romita Jr.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #560-561
  • Amazing Spider-Man #290

There are two Spider-Men running around New York, and they're not clones or Skrulls! Spider-Man is determined to uncover the truth, but things go from bad to worse as he faces a horde of supervillans and the Enforces!

By Bob Gale and Mike McKone

Also: Classic action. Spider-Man battles the Spider-Slayer.

By David Micheline and John Romita Jr.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #562-563
  • Amazing Spider-Man #291

An incredible new Saga begins! Spider-Man teams-up with Daredevil, and who is the mysterious woman who wants to kill Spider-Man!?

By Marc Guggenheim and Phil Jimenez.

Classic action: Spider-Man versus the Spider-Slayer round two!

By David Michelinie and Alex Saviuk.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #564-565
  • Amazing Spider-Man #292

A Secret Invasion chapter! An army of Skrulls are invading New York, but why is Spider-Man attacking Jackpot??

By Brian Reed and Marcos Santucci.

Also: Can Spider-Man save Vin Gonzales from the mystery woman!?

By Marc Guggenheim and Phil JImemez.

Classic Action: Peter Parker proposes to Mary Jane!

By David Michelinie and Paul Ryan.

Collects

  • Secret Invasion: Amazing Spider-Man #1.
  • Amazing Spider-Man #566.
  • Amazing Spider-Man Annual #21.

A Secret Invasion chapter! While Spider-Man fights to survive in the Savage Land, Jackpot faces the Skrull invasion of New York!

By Brian Reed and Marco Santucci

Plus Spider-Man faces the Fury of Vermin!

By Marc Guggenheim and Phil JImemez

Classic marvel history as Peter Parker marries Mary Jane!!

By David Michelinie and Paul Ryan.

Collects:

  • Secret Invasion: Amazing Spider-Man #2.
  • Amazing Spider-Man #567.
  • Amazing Spider-Man Annual #21.

While Spider-Man fights to save the world, Jackpot fights for her life against Menace and a Super-Skrull!

By Brian Reed and Marco Santucci.

A new Saga begins, New Ways To Die. Spider-Man battles Menace, unaware that dark forces are aligning against him!

By Dan Slott and John Romita Jr.

Peter Parker and Mary Jane are off on their honeymoon.

By James C. Owsley and and Alan Kupperberg

Collects:

  • Secret Invasion: Amazing Spider-Man #3.
  • Amazing Spider-Man #568.
  • The Spectacular Spider-Man Annual #7.

Peter Parker is in a world of trouble, Spider-man is public enemy number one and now he's got Norman Osborn and the Thunderbolts after him and who is the Anti-Venom?

By Dan Slott and John Romita Jr.

Classic Action: Spider-Man's mission for Puma proves to be more dangerous then expected.

By James C. Owsley and Alan Kupperberg.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #569-570.
  • The Spectacular Spider-Man Annual #7.

It's kill or cure as Spider-Man feels the power of Anti-Venom and finds himself the tartget of bullseye! Meanwhile Norman Osborn battles Menace.

By Dan Slott and John Romita Jr.

Classic Action: Doctor Octopus returns! However can one of Spidey's deadliest foes defeat the Web-Slinger when he's suffering from the worst case of arachnophobia??

By David Michelinie and Alex Saviuk

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #571-572.
  • Amazing Spider-Man #296.

New Ways to Die reaches its amazing conclusion - and it's all-out war! Spider-Man and Anti-Venom take the fight to Norman Osborn and the Thunderbolts!

By Dan Slott and John Romita Jr.

Also: Spidey and Jackpot team up to battle a new villain... Blindside!

By Marc Guggenheim and Mike McKone.

Classic Action: Spider-Man versus Doctor Octopus!

By David Michelinie and Alex Saviuk.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man #573.
  • Amazing Spider-Man Annual 2008.
  • Amazing Spider-Man #297.

Jackpot's secrets are finally revealed as she and Spider-Man confront Blindside!

By Marc Guggenheim and Mike McKone.

Collects:

  • Amazing Spider-Man Annual 2008.
  • Amazing Spider-Man #574.
  • Amazing Spider-Man 301.

This is the big one! The results are in, the masks are off and Spider-Man might just go down forever! With the secret of Menace revealed and the identity of the Spider-Tracer killer brought to light, the world of Peter Parker, Harry Osborn, Lily Hollister, Carlie Cooper and Vin Gonzales will never be the same! Questions you’ve asked since Spider-Man first entered his Brand New Day will be answered. But who will be left standing to pick up the pieces…and how does it involve Norman Osborn? This one’s a can’t miss, so be there for the conclusion of CHARACTER ASSASSINATION!

Plus, classic adventure! Mary Jane is missing and Spider-Man is gonna tear down New York to find her! However, first he’s gotta survive Styx and Stone!

Story and art by Marc Guggenheim, John Romita Jr, David Michelinie and Todd McFarlane!

Includes material reprinted from Amazing Spider-Man #588 and Amazing Spider-Man #309! 76 pages! £2.95

The Chameleon is poised to unleash unspeakable horror on New York City and Spider-Man is nowhere to be found, so the only person who can stop him is... Mary Jane Watson?!!

Also, look out, Spidey! Hot on the heels of his old girlfriend, The Black Cat’s back and more dangerous than ever!

Plus, classic action as Venom wreaks his revenge on the web-slinger!

Includes material reprinted from Amazing Spider-Man #603-604 and Amazing Spider-Man #316! 76 pages! £2.95

Mary Jane Watson has returned to New York ... and all the worse for her because of what The Chameleon is about to do to it! Time is running out, no one knows whose face the Master of Disguise is wearing now, and Everyone's Friendly Neighbourhood Spider-Man is locked in a death-duel with Mayor J. Jonah Jameson's all-new Spider-Slayer Squad!

Plus, Kaine returns! Where has the ill-fated Peter Parker Clone been all these years? Where is he now? And what is his connection to Kraven!?!

Story and art by Frederick Van Lente, Javier Pulido, Jean Marc DeMatteis and Val Semeiks!

Includes material reprinted from Amazing Spider-Man #605 and Web Of Spider-Man Vol.2 #1! 76 pages! £2.95

Cartoon Books proudly presents Jeff Smith's new adventure series - RASL - a stark, sci-fi series about a dimension-jumping art thief, a man unplugged from the world who races through space and time searching for his next big score - and trying to escape his past. In this first of three graphic novels, Rasl faces an assassin's bullet and stumbles across a mystery that not only threatens to expose his own illicit activities, but could also uncover one of the world's most dangerous and sought after secrets! Contains mature content.

Collection of the first three issues of RASL in a deluxe oversize softcover
name: Volume 1

description:
Jeff Smith's fast paced sci-fi thriller about an inter-dimensional art thief continues in this action-packed graphic novel. The secrets of RASL's technology and his hidden past are exposed when a mysterious lizard-faced stranger starts killing the art thief's girlfriends in multiple universes. The stranger knows that RASL used to work for the military-industrial complex on a project codenamed The St. George Array, and believes that RASL has stolen secrets that will unlock the power of the universe.

Collects issues #4-7 of RASL in a Deluxe oversize paperback.
name: Volume 2

description:
From the New York Times best-selling author of Bone comes a hardboiled sci-fi tale about a dimension-jumping art thief - a man unplugged from the world, racing through space and time searching for his next big score and trying to escape his past. Cartoonist Jeff Smith continues the critically acclaimed noir adventures of RASL, as the art thief tries desperately to hold on to anything constant in his fast changing world.

Collects issues #8-11 of RASL
name: Volume 3

volume.name: RASL: Romance at the Speed of Light

Morphine Dream #21
name: Bone Saw

description: Ghost Talker's Daydream is a horror anime created by Saki Okuse and Sankichi Meguro. It tells the story of Misaki Saiki, a young woman with a troubled past, who is a professional dominatrix in one of Tokyo's most exclusive S&M clubs. However, her real money is something she likes even less than being a dominatrix. Ever since childhood, Misaki has had the ability to see and communicate with ghosts, and that talent is put to use by the Livelihood Protection Agency, who pairs Misaki with Souichiro Kadotake, a martial artist who happens to be deathly afraid of ghosts. Using her gifts, Misaki is able to help troubled departed spirits resolve what is troubling them and allow them to move on to the afterlife. If all THAT isn't odd enough, Misaki is an albino AND a virgin.
name: Vol. 1

description: Welcome to the sexy, spooky, and suspenseful world of Ghost Talker's Daydream. In the continuing story of Saiki Misaki, the albino dominatrix necromancer, Misaki has to put her wits, looks and knowledge of ghosts to the test. Follow Misaki as she dodges cops, fights psychos, and exorcises the dead. Fast-paced, smart, and sassy, Ghost Talker's Daydream is everything you loved about the anime and much, much more.
name: Vol. 2

description: After a young lesbian mysteriously dies her spirit begins to haunt her lover. Who do you call when the ghost of your ex-lover keeps terrorizing you? Saiki Misaki, the albino dominatrix necromancer, of course! The highly sexualized and eerily suspenseful tale of Ghost Talker's Daydream hits a provocative high point. Follow Saiki as she uses her powers to solve another nail-biting mystery filled with terrifying twists.
name: Vol. 3

description: If having hallucinations is scary, seeing them at school would be terrifying. But when the hallucinations talk back to you, that's the kind of fright you've come to expect from the world ofGhost Talker's Daydream. Come join Saiki Misaki, the albino dominatrix necromancer, as she jumps headfirst into another supernatural mystery. This time around, the case becomes more personal, as the power that gives Saiki the ability to see and talk to the dead is the very thing terrorizing her client.
name: Vol. 4

description: Saiki Misaki, our albino dominatrix necromancer hero, can't seem to get away from dead people. Even while on vacation! Far from home, resting at a spa resort, Misaki still seems to be a magnet for tragic stories and creepy scenes. And sometimes the creepy stuff just comes looking for her. In volume five of Ghost Talker's Daydream, Misaki's partner from back home is racing to find her with a few colorful characters in tow, namely the young stalker who's obsessed with Misaki, and a young girl who is also a budding necromancer. The result is a long trip to the world of the dead.
name: Vol. 5

description: These stories are told with the same bold, kinetic art style and brilliantly paced storytelling that Samura's Blade of the Immortal epic is famous for. The main offering, "Ohikkoshi," follows the turbulent paths of several twenty-something art students as they fall in love, fall in lust, play in rock bands, ride motorbikes, eat, sleep (together), and try to avoid making life decisions while drunk. This romantic comedy is a "Japanese art school confidential" packed with absurd humor, obscure death metal references, and some expertly placed, dramatic revelations. "Luncheon of Tears Diary" is a vibrant, genre-busting tale that also peppers its humor with sharp, dramatic moments. Natsumi Funabashi, a virgin, is an aspiring manga creator on a quest for love and a fulfilling career. Along the way, she has to cope with overzealous men, gang warfare, a mahjong addiction, and a lascivious manga editor. This collection is rounded off by Samura's hilarious "Kyoto Super Barhopping Journal: Bloodbath at Midorogaike," a rare, autobiographical travel piece.
name: TPB

description: Hiroaki Samura's Blade of the Immortal epic is a unique, expertly paced manga series that mixes Edo-era samurai grudge matches with anachronistic punk attitudes and mannerisms. It's also one of the longest-running manga series in the U.S.! Samura's stirring tale of a warrior's search for redemption and a young girl's quest for revenge has taken the world by storm, winning numerous awards across the globe and spawning an anime series and a novel spinoff. In Dark Horse's The Art of Blade of the Immortal, Hiroaki Samura's lush color paintings, detailed line work, and selected story pages and chapter breaks are on display in an oversized, 9" x 12", hardcover collection. This Dark Horse edition also includes an exclusive section with thirty-two extra pages of artwork, an introduction by acclaimed artist Geof Darrow (The Matrix Comics, Hard Boiled), and a translated afterword by Samura.
name: OGN

volume.name: Art of Blade of the Immortal

description: Collecting issues #1-6 of the acclaimed maxiseries by Warren Ellis! Miranda Zero, the mysterious leader/benefactor/recruiter of Global Frequency is a woman with a mission. She saves people. She and 1,000 others make up the most diverse team of specialists the planet has ever seen. Their job? To save the world, usually before anyone else notices there's a problem.
name: Volume 1
